doc.after: The Crusades were a series of military conflicts of a religious character waged by much of Christian Europe against external and internal threats Crusades were fought against Muslims pagan Slavs Russian and Greek Orthodox Christians Mongols Cathars Hussites Jews and political enemies of the popes Crusaders took vows and were granted an indulgence for past sins
